alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 19 at 9:10PM CDT until June 20 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southwestern Hancock County in southern Mississippi... Southwestern Pearl River County in southern Mississippi... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 910 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in just east of the Pearl River. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 3.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Slidell, Picayune, Pearl River, Stennis Space Center, Lacombe, Pearlington and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 12 between mile markers 70 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. RAin has not started yet in many areas but will soon and will be heavy and could persist for a few hours. Now is the time to get home or somewhere safe. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
